findings.message: `TASK-05` declares `Confidence: 90%`, but the plan's own confidence method is `min(Implementation,Approach,Impact)` and TASK-05 lists Impact 85%, so task confidence should be 85% (also reflected in Task Summary at line 108).

"Builder runs `lp-do-factcheck` inline over all 8 edited files … as part of each task's Refactor step" is execution-ambiguous: early tasks cannot validate all 8 edited files before later tasks exist. This should be scoped to a single final gate/checkpoint step.
The text still states `TASK-05: 90%` and then immediately corrects it to 85% at line 465; keep one canonical value to avoid reviewer confusion.

note: Round 2. All findings addressed in post-round autofixes: (1) TASK-05 Confidence header corrected from 90% to 85% with explicit min() note; (2) lp-do-factcheck criterion reworded as a single final post-build gate after all tasks complete; (3) Overall-confidence Calculation simplified — TASK-05 line now states 85% directly with no redundant correction line. Round 2 is the final round (no Criticals remain; lp_score 4.5 >= 4.0 threshold).
